TextBody:
Hello Yunus,

Unfortunately there is no version available for 5.6.0.We recommend to try and upgrade the server to the latest version which is 5.9.4.1 and try again.

Before any attempts, please take a snapshot of your endpoint protector appliance from the virtualization environment. That way, in case anything happens, you can revert to the original settings.

After you do the snapshot, please go to the EPP server and perform the live update:



If the EPP server is on an air gapped environment, please let me know so we can provide you the offline patches.

Looking forward to your response.

Best Regards,
Marian Ilies | Technical Support Engineer

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #439280 -  - Linux Agent    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0N5puH:ref ]

TextBody:
Hello Yunus,

Thanks for getting back to me.

Unfortunately, due to the fact that the 5.6.0 is 3 years old already, we do not have a confirmation from our tests for a backwards compatibility of such long period of time discrepancy between the server and the client.

As per this, we recommend our customers to use the latest server version associated with the latest client version.

The client improvements are also sometimes related to the server functionalities hence why we do not have a backwards compatibility for such a long period.

Looking forward to your response.

Best Regards,
Marian Ilies | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.netwrix.com
